name: IZERVAY
indications: izervay™ indicated treatment geographic atrophy ( ga ) secondary age-related macular degeneration ( amd ) .
contraindications: recommended dose izervay 2 mg ( 0.1 ml 20 mg/ml solution ) administered intravitreal injection affected eye monthly ( approximately 28 ± 7 days ) ( 2.2 ) .
warningsAndPrecautions: izervay ( avacincaptad pegol intravitreal solution ) supplied sterile , clear slightly opalescent , colorless slightly yellowish 20 mg/ml solution single-dose glass vial . glass vial contains overfill amount allow single 0.1 ml dose solution containing 2 mg avacincaptad pegol ( oligonucleotide basis ) . izervay carton ( ndc 82829-002-01 ) contains one glass vial , one sterile 5-micron transfer filter needle ( 18-gauge x 1½ inch , 1.2 mm x 40 mm ) , one sterile 1 ml luer lock syringe .
adverseReactions: • ocular periocular infections ( 4.1 ) . • active intraocular inflammation ( 4.2 ) .
indications_original: IZERVAY™ is indicated for the treatment of geographic atrophy (GA) secondary to age-related macular degeneration (AMD).
contraindications_original: The recommended dose for IZERVAY is 2 mg (0.1 mL of 20 mg/mL solution) administered by intravitreal injection to each affected eye once monthly (approximately 28 ± 7 days) ( 2.2 ).
warningsAndPrecautions_original: IZERVAY (avacincaptad pegol intravitreal solution) is supplied as a sterile, clear to slightly opalescent, colorless to slightly yellowish 20 mg/mL solution in a single-dose glass vial. Each glass vial contains an overfill amount to allow administration of a single 0.1 mL dose of solution containing 2 mg of avacincaptad pegol (oligonucleotide basis). Each IZERVAY carton (NDC 82829-002-01) contains one glass vial, one sterile 5-micron transfer filter needle (18-gauge x 1½ inch, 1.2 mm x 40 mm), and one sterile 1 mL Luer lock syringe.
adverseReactions_original: • Ocular or periocular infections ( 4.1 ). • Active intraocular inflammation ( 4.2 ).
